creator: Leonid Nikolayevich Andreyev
description:
LibriVox recording of The Man Who Found the Truth by Leonid Nikolayevich Andreyev. (Translated by Herman Bernstein.)
Read in English by Crln Yldz Ksr
An old man, accused of having murdered his family as a young man, spends a lifetime in prison. With brilliant psychological insight so characteristic of Leonid Andreyev's work, we follow this man telling his story about his obsession with truth and lies and his religion of the iron grate, tinged by madness, and not necessarily reliable.. - Summary by Carolin
For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording.

For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org.
